name: Myths, Masks, and Minutes Spent Apart

cards.rules_text:
When this enchantment enters, target opponent reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it and exile that card until this enchantment leaves the battlefield. You lose 1 life.
Your opponents can't cast spells with the same name as the exiled card.
When this creature enters, you may discard a card. If you do, search your library for a card with the same mana value as the discarded card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.special_text:
[+2]: Draw a card, then each opponent discards a card.
[-2]: Exile target permanent you control. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step. Each opponent sacrifices a permanent that shares a type with the exiled permanent.
[-X]: Exile target card in your graveyard with mana value X. Copy it. You may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.rules_text:
Flash
Flying
Whenever this creature or another creature you control enters, you may return target creature you control other than the creature that entered to its owner's hand.
cards.notes: “Patience is a virtue—one you ought to learn.”

cards.rules_text:
Prowess
Whenever this creature attacks, you may cast target instant or sorcery card with mana value less than or equal to this creature's power from your graveyard without paying its mana cost. If that spell would be put into your graveyard, exile it instead.

Vanishing X [i](This permanent enters with X time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)[/i]
Whenever this enchantment enters or you remove a time counter from it, you may exile target nonland card from your graveyard with mana value less than or equal to the number of time counters on this enchantment plus one. Copy it and you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

Indestructible, haste
This creature can't block.
Whenever you sacrifice a permanent, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.

If you control three or fewer lands, exile target nonland permanent with mana value 3 or less.
Cycling—Sacrifice a land. [i](Sacrifice a land, Discard this card: Draw a card.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Take what you need, share the rest.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Vigilance
When this creature enters, surveil 1, then create a Weapon token. [i](It's an Equipment with equip {2} and “Equipped creature gets +1/+1.”)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Whatever portent it may herald, it means no harm; it is itself the sense of dread, not the danger that warrants it.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
When this creature enters, choose one —
• Remove up to two counters from target permanent you don't control.
• Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
cards.flavor_text: [i]To be a seer, Kriemhild would need to learn the ways of all her people.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Deception {2}{W} [i]({2}{W}, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)[/i]
Flying
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Warkrei follow a commandment to harm “no thing that flies.” The sky, and all it holds, is to be ruled only by the divine.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When this enchantment enters, exile target nonland permanent you don't control with mana value 3 or less until Innocence Denied leaves the battlefield.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The Warkrei don't understand the ways of Zwiewald and don't care to learn. Their values are irrefutable, by proof of conquest.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Exile target creature you control or creature card in your graveyard with mana value 3 or less. Then return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Her future uncertain, she chose to focus on the present: putting one foot in front of the other.[/i]
cards.notes:
Fassahd
Anina
Her future uncertain, she chose to focus on the present; putting one foot in front of the other.

cards.rules_text: Boast — {W}: Exile target creature you control, then return that card to the battlefield under your control. [i](Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)[/i]

Vigilance
Noncreature spells cost {1} more to cast.
Activated abilities cost {1} more to activate unless they're mana abilities.

Boast — {W}: This creature gains first strike until end of turn. [i](Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)[/i]
Boast — {W}: Until your next turn, target player that was dealt combat damage this turn can't cast noncreature spells.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile two nonland cards from your graveyard. If you do, create a 3/2 white Wolf Spirit creature token.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Elissia and Ludolf, for all their differences, found peace together. They departed Ruhigwelt, hand in hand.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Choose one, then each opponent chooses another one —
• Destroy all creatures with power 3 or greater.
• Destroy all creatures with power 2 or less.
• Destroy all artifacts.
• Destroy all enchantments.
• Exile all graveyards.
Whenever another creature you control becomes blocked, you may return it to your hand. If you do, put a +1/+1 counter on this creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Just as the cycle of the moon, we must know when to stride forward, and when to let others pass us by.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Deception—Exile a card from your graveyard. [i](Exile a card from your graveyard, Return an unblocked attacker you control to hand: Put this card onto the battlefield from your hand tapped and attacking.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Don't bother with the ‘why,' just pay up and point me in the right direction.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Boast—Discard a card: This creature gains indestructible until end of turn. [i](Activate only if this creature attacked this turn and only once each turn.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Adventurous civilians see opportunity behind the Warkrei advance: new lands to claim, and with it, new titles to earn.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Avior are reclusive, but their counsel is held in high esteem. They hear many things, carried across the world on fickle winds.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Whenever you commune, you may tap target creature. [i](You commune as you spend your third mana on unique activated abilities during a turn.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Even tucked away out of sight, it's hard to miss a Jaegrin village. At all hours, one can hear their music: lively, uptempo, and eminently danceable.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Vanishing 3 [i](This creature enters with three time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]The Jaegrin are fond of corvids, no matter their size. The two share an insatiable curiosity, and a propensity for getting into trouble.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Vanishing 2 [i](This permanent enters with two time counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a time counter from it. When the last is removed, sacrifice it.)[/i]
When the last time counter is removed from this enchantment, up to one target creature's owner puts it on the top or bottom of their library.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Kriemhild never doubted her friend, even as the rest of the Fassahd placed blame at her feet.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Counter target noncreature spell unless its controller pays {2}.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“I have shown you my face, hexer. Will you return the courtesy, and let us speak as equals?”
—Dietrich, to a Warkrei envoy[/i]

cards.rules_text: Return target creature to its owner's hand. If that creature was attacking, surveil 1.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Every moment holds a thousand possibilities. Why choose just one?[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]She had been charged with bringing light to the depths of the forest, and happened to know just the people for the job.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Counter target creature spell. You may put a loyalty counter on an Elissia planeswalker you control.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Kriemhild!” Elissia shouted. “I know it looks like there's only one way forward, but you can always choose how you walk that path!” The familiar phrase gave her pause, and with it, the will to oust Ziel.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Surveil 1, then draw a card.
At the beginning of each end step, if you've communed this turn, return this card from your graveyard to your hand. [i](You've communed if you've spent three or more mana on unique activated abilities during a turn.)[/i]
cards.flavor_text: [i]Freed from Ziel's influence, Kriemhild still had his secrets. She soothed the spirits, and soon, her people. [/i]

cards.flavor_text:
[i]“. . . and she hung the sun in the sky, and divided the night and day, and said to us ‘We will live in the light from now on.' For the dark was granted to all things malign, in the hopes that with a home of their own, they would leave us.”
—Fables of the Fassahd[/i]

cards.rules_text: Until end of turn, target creature gains “When this creature dies, return it to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control. When you do, each opponent loses 2 life.”
cards.flavor_text: [i]“Brunhild?” was all Kriemhild could manage to say. The two stared in silence, until a third spoke up: “What a delightful little conclusion.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: When this creature enters, choose target opponent. If you've sacrificed a permanent this turn, they reveal their hand, you choose a nonland card from it, and they discard that card. Otherwise, they discard a card.
At the beginning of your end step, if you've sacrificed a permanent this turn, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Nature is, if not capricious, unpredictable. It is wise to remember this, and to always exercise appropriate caution.[/i]

Reveal the top three cards of your library. For each card revealed this way, an opponent may discard a card. If they do, put that card into your graveyard. Otherwise, put it into your hand and you lose 2 life.

You may pay {3}. If you do, choose a nonland card name. Otherwise, choose the name of up to one nonland card in a graveyard. Search target player's graveyard, hand, and libraries for any number of cards with that name and exile them. That player shuffles, then draws a card for each card exiled from their hand this way.

cards.flavor_text: [i]Trolls are happy to lend their decades of wisdom to those who need it. Just don't expect a quick answer.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Just as a swallow's song may herald spring, spirits stir in anticipation of great change.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]It takes a great deal to move a troll to anger—and a great deal more than that to halt their momentum.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]As Ludolf fell, the field traded bloodstains for bluebonnets. To his surprise—and unease—his life was not yet over.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Ludolf had ended countless lives, back on a world he'd rather forget. Banishing Ziel was different, though: for once, he was carving a story's beginning.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]Ruhe is a time to reflect—it's easier to think while the world is calm, quiet, and cold. There is, then, the need to still movement; to muffle noise; to smother warmth.[/i]

cards.rules_text: {T}: Add {G}. Spend this mana only to activate an ability.
cards.flavor_text: [i]His role is to teach the young, by way of stories, the history of their people. But he only ever wants to act out Riverbed's Fall, despite his pupils' protests.[/i]

cards.flavor_text: [i]She was first to break the silence: “Emmerich, we've been here for hours . . .” He looked down at her, shook his head, and chuckled. “And we will be here for hours yet, Kriemhild, if that is what it takes to teach you how to listen.”[/i]

cards.rules_text: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control if you have 10 or less life. Then it fights target creature an opponent controls.
cards.flavor_text: [i][/i]Mahg and the White Bear[i] is most often told as a tale of hubris. Some Fassahd take a different message to heart.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Target creature you control deals damage equal to its power to target creature you don't control. If the creature you don't control has flying, it deals twice that amount of damage instead.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Hunters know well the power of surprise. [/i]

cards.rules_text: Reveal the top three cards of your library. You may put a creature or land card from among them into your hand and the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
cards.flavor_text:
[i]“So it's decided: I'm going to succeed Dietrich as seer. I'm happy, and nervous, and even a little sad. Bruhild and I are going different ways, it seems.”
—Kriemhild's journal[/i]
